summary: This document is a series of emails from whistleblower Christopher J. Dilorio to SEC officials, alleging massive SEC corruption, obstruction, and facilitation of financial fraud. Dilorio claims the SEC ignored overwhelming evidence of money laundering, manipulation, and fraud involving companies like BLNK (Blink Charging), NETE (Net Element), and Knight Capital (NITE/KCG/VIRT), and links these entities to figures like Michael Farkas, Jeffrey Epstein, and political fundraisers.

persons.name: Christopher J. Dilorio
persons.context: Author of the emails, alleging SEC corruption and detailed knowledge of money laundering schemes involving multiple companies and individuals.

persons.name: Michael Farkas
persons.role: Businessman, alleged 'Bag Man', largest shareholder of SkyWay
persons.context: Identified as a 'Bag Man' and the largest shareholder of money laundering shell SkyWay, later CEO of BLNK (Blink Charging). Linked to Trump fundraisers and Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as a business partner of Andrew/Jonathan Farkas and linked to Bill Richardson's New Mexico Zorro Ranch.

persons.name: Bill Richardson
persons.context: Linked to Jeffrey Epstein and his New Mexico Zorro Ranch, mentioned as 'icing on the top' of the alleged SEC-facilitated fraud involving BLNK.

persons.name: Andrew Farkas
persons.role: Trump fundraiser, business partner of Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as a Trump fundraiser and business partner of Jeffrey Epstein, linked to the fraud involving BLNK.

persons.name: Jonathan Farkas
persons.role: Trump fundraiser, business partner of Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned alongside Andrew Farkas as a Trump fundraiser and business partner of Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Janey
persons.context: SEC official repeatedly addressed in the emails, accused of not distributing the whistleblower's information and being part of the obstruction.

persons.name: Hoecker
persons.context: SEC official addressed in the emails, part of the group accused of corrupt obstruction.

persons.name: Jay
persons.context: SEC official addressed in the emails.

persons.name: Justin Keener
persons.context: Described as a 'Bag Man' known to the SEC, barred by FINRA but allegedly kept operating. Involved with money laundering shells including BLNK.

persons.name: Joshie Sason
persons.context: Alleged 'Bag Man' involved with Hanover/Magna and multiple companies (CGFIA, IMDS, NewLead, FreeSeas, PRTH). Subject of an SEC complaint which the whistleblower claims is based on his information.

persons.name: Engel
persons.role: Board Member of BLNK, associated with Drexel
persons.context: Board member of BLNK, linked to Drexel and Milken.

persons.name: Bill Scigliano
persons.role: Chairman of the Board, associated with Acies Corp
persons.context: Chairman of the Board for BLNK, also a director at Oleg Firer's Acies Corp, linked to money laundering shells.

persons.name: Oleg Firer
persons.role: Alleged 'Bag Man', associated with Acies Corp
persons.context: Described as a 'prolific Bag Man', associated with Acies Corp, Allied Wallet, and WireCard.

persons.name: Barry Honig
persons.context: Linked to the Jaclin money laundering shell PRComplete/YESDtc. Mentioned as another 'Bag Man'.

persons.name: Jared Fishman
persons.context: Identified as a Sullivan & Cromwell colleague of Chair Clayton, accused of playing a key role in keeping Knight Capital (NITE/VIRT) operating.

persons.name: Chair Clayton
persons.context: SEC Chairman accused of not disclosing conflicts related to Sullivan & Cromwell, Jared Fishman, and Knight Capital (NITE).

persons.name: Carl
persons.context: SEC official referenced in a sarcastic tone regarding a non-thorough investigation.

persons.name: McKessy
persons.context: SEC official mentioned as being in possession of the whistleblower's 2013 TCR.

persons.name: Berger
persons.context: SEC official with whom the whistleblower filed a 2013 TCR.

persons.name: Ajay Tandon
persons.context: Co-founder of SeeThroughEquity, LLC, subject of an SEC complaint for pump-and-dump schemes involving NETE.

persons.name: Amit Tandon
persons.context: Co-founder of SeeThroughEquity, LLC, subject of an SEC complaint for pump-and-dump schemes involving NETE.

connections.description: Implied connection through business partner Andrew/Jonathan Farkas, and Michael Farkas's role in companies alleged to be part of money laundering schemes.
Linked to Jeffrey Epstein and his New Mexico Zorro Ranch.
Implied to be related (possibly brothers) as both are referred to as 'Farkas' and linked to Trump fundraisers and fraud.
Both described as 'Bag Men' involved in overlapping money laundering shell companies like BLNK and SkyWay.
Both are labeled as 'Bag Men' by the whistleblower and are alleged to be part of the same ecosystem of fraud involving money laundering shells.
Scigliano was a director at Firer's company, Acies Corp.
Both are mentioned as 'Bag Men' involved in Jaclin money laundering shells.
Colleagues at Sullivan & Cromwell; Fishman accused of helping keep Knight Capital operating.
Dilorio is the whistleblower repeatedly sending allegations and appeals to SEC official Janey.

events.title: BLNK Press Release and Stock Pump
events.description: BLNK (Blink Charging) issued a press release about being awarded a grant for charging stations, driving the stock up almost 30%. The whistleblower alleges this was a fraudulent pump-and-dump scheme with no corresponding SEC 8-K filing.

events.title: SEC Approval of BLNK Public Offering
events.description: The SEC declared effective a public offering of securities for BLNK, which the whistleblower claims was approved despite his overwhelming evidence of fraud being in the SEC's hands.

events.title: Knight Capital 'Glitch'
events.description: Referenced as an orchestrated 'glitch' that caused Knight Capital's stock to collapse, after which Blackstone considered buying it.

events.title: SEC Charges UBS with AML Violations
events.description: The SEC announced settled charges against UBS Financial Services Inc. for failing to report suspicious transactions, resulting in a $5 million penalty.

events.title: SEC Complaint Against SeeThroughEquity
events.description: The SEC brought a complaint against SeeThroughEquity, LLC and the Tandon brothers for pump-and-dump schemes, including promotion of NETE.

events.title: SEC Jaclin 'Shell Factory' Complaint
events.description: The SEC filed a complaint against Jaclin et al., detailing a 'shell factory' operation, which included New Image Concepts (later BLNK).

events.title: FINRA Bars Justin Keener/JMJ
events.description: FINRA barred Justin Keener/JMJ as a 'Bad Actor' for anti-money laundering violations and refusing to provide information.

events.title: Whistleblower's Formal Appeal
events.description: Christopher Dilorio submitted a 'Formal appeal for preliminary denial covered action 2015-016' regarding his Knight Capital TCR, summarizing years of allegations.

keyFacts: The whistleblower, Christopher J. Dilorio, alleges the SEC is grossly corrupt, actively facilitating massive fraud and money laundering by ignoring overwhelming evidence and protecting entities like Knight Capital (NITE/KCG/VIRT).
BLNK (Blink Charging) is presented as a central example of a 'money laundering shell' linked to Michael Farkas, Justin Keener, and through them to Trump fundraisers and Jeffrey Epstein.

The document connects financial fraud to prominent figures, including Jeffrey Epstein (via business partners Andrew/Jonathan Farkas) and former Governor Bill Richardson (linked to Epstein's Zorro Ranch).
The whistleblower claims the SEC uses mechanisms like the Obligation Warehouse (OW) to help Knight Capital circumvent Reg SHO rules and continue naked short selling.
Multiple companies are named as part of an alleged fraud ecosystem: BLNK, NETE (Net Element), SkyWay, and various 'shells' connected to individuals like Jaclin, Sason, Honig, and Firer.
